segments.source_content:
---
slug: /188
title: "This Week In React #188: React 19 RC0, Data Fetching, Framer Motion, Compiler, Astro, Zod, Remix, Docusaurus, React-Query,, Memory Leaks, Spline, Module Mocking, Slow Networks, MS Edge, RN Security Guide, RN 0.74.2, Reanimated 3.12, Turborepo 2, Biome 1.8..."
authors: [bndkt]
date: 06-06-2024
---

translations.ja: @@untranslatable_placeholder_58cfcc64

segments.source_content: Hey,

translations.ja: こんにちは、

segments.source_content: This is [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt) this week, filling in for Sébastien who’s taking a newsletter break.

translations.ja: 今週は[Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt)が担当します。ニュースレター休暇中のSébastienに代わってお届けします。

segments.source_content: React 19 is nearing its final release, with the first RC published this week. Apart from this, there’s not a lot of release activity in the React and React Native communities. So this week, I decided to feature two great pieces of content as headlines in both sections. A seminal 10k-word-long article about Data Fetching Patterns in Single-Page Applications by Juntao Qiu, and a great video overview of all the different ways to build React Native apps with Expo by Simon Grimm.

translations.ja: React 19は最終リリースが間近に迫っており、今週最初のRCが公開されました。それ以外では、ReactとReact Nativeコミュニティでのリリース活動はあまり活発ではありません。そこで今週は、両セクションのヘッドラインとして2つの素晴らしいコンテンツを特集することにしました。Juntao Qiuによるシングルページアプリケーションにおけるデータ取得パターンに関する1万字に及ぶ記念碑的な記事と、Simon GrimmによるExpoを使ったReact Nativeアプリ構築のさまざまな方法を網羅した素晴らしい動画解説です。

segments.source_content: I wanted to use this opportunity to let you know that both Sébastien and I put a lot of effort into finding the best content for the React and React Native sections, but I’m sure there is still great stuff that sometimes goes unnoticed. That’s why we’re always open to suggestions, so feel free to let us know when you put something out there!

translations.ja: この機会にぜひお伝えしたいのですが、Sébastienと私はReactとReact Nativeセクションのための最高のコンテンツを見つけるために多くの努力を払っていますが、それでも見逃してしまう素晴らしいコンテンツがあるかもしれません。そのため、私たちは常に提案を受け付けていますので、何か公開された際にはぜひお知らせください！

segments.source_content: <!-- truncate -->

segments.source_content: **[Build your product skills](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir)**

translations.ja: **[プロダクトスキルを構築する](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir)**

segments.source_content: [**Product for Engineers**](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir) is PostHog’s newsletter dedicated to helping engineers improve their product skills. Learn what questions to ask users, how to build new features users love, and the path to product market fit.

translations.ja: [**エンジニアのためのプロダクト**](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir)は、PostHogが提供するエンジニア向けニュースレターで、プロダクトスキルの向上を支援します。ユーザーに尋ねるべき質問、ユーザーが愛する新機能の構築方法、プロダクトマーケットフィットへの道筋などを学べます。

segments.source_content: [**Subscribe for free**](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir) to get curated advice on building great products, lessons (and mistakes) from building PostHog, and deep dives into the strategies of top startups.

translations.ja: [**無料で購読**](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=twir)して、優れたプロダクトを構築するための厳選されたアドバイス、PostHog構築からの教訓（と失敗）、トップスタートアップの戦略に関する深堀りを入手しましょう。

segments.source_content: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

translations.ja: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

segments.source_content: 📜 **[Data Fetching Patterns in Single-Page Applications](https://martinfowler.com/articles/data-fetch-spa.html)**

translations.ja: 📜 **[シングルページアプリケーションにおけるデータ取得パターン](https://martinfowler.com/articles/data-fetch-spa.html)**

segments.source_content: This is a long read (\~10k words), but such a great article! The title doesn’t do its justice, because in passing, this covers so much more than just data fetching. Basic React concepts, Suspense, async state handling, code splitting, prefetching, and parallel data fetching to avoid waterfalls. There has been a lot of discussion on X about web app performance in the last few weeks (Rails vs. React, MS Edge decision, …) - this is a great article to freshen up the basics of this topic to build a great user experience!

translations.ja: 長文（約1万字）ですが、非常に素晴らしい記事です！タイトル以上の内容が詰まっており、データ取得だけでなく、基本的なReactの概念、Suspense、非同期状態処理、コード分割、プリフェッチ、ウォーターフォールを避けるための並列データ取得など、多くのトピックをカバーしています。ここ数週間、X（旧Twitter）ではウェブアプリのパフォーマンスに関する多くの議論（Rails vs. React、MS Edgeの決定など）がありましたが、この記事は優れたユーザー体験を構築するための基礎を復習するのに最適です！

segments.source_content:
* 💸 [Meilisearch - Build search as you type for React](https://www.meilisearch.com/with/react?utm_campaign=sponsoring\&utm_source=thisweekinreact)
* 👀 [React Router PR - defineRoute API](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11596)
* 🐦 [shadcn/ui is working on adding charts](https://x.com/shadcn/status/1795920488797188525)
* 🐦 [Remix working inside a Cloudflare Durable Object 🤯](https://x.com/threepointone/status/1796223745243119890)
* 🐦 [React 19.0.0-rc.0](https://x.com/acdlite/status/1797668537349328923): Andrew Clark says “This is the exact build we'll release as 19.0, unless an issue is reported that requires a breaking change.”
* 🐦 [Upcoming Spline (3D rendering) and NextJS RSC integration](https://x.com/rauchg/status/1798021886657650711)
* 📜 [I tried React Compiler today, and guess what …](https://www.developerway.com/posts/i-tried-react-compiler): A super interesting and detailed article about React Compiler and real-world use cases. Seems like we’re not at the point yet where we can just ignore everything about memoization because the Compiler takes care of it, and apart from this conclusion the article is also a great reminder of how memoization works exactly.
* 📜 [Do you still need Framer Motion?](https://motion.dev/blog/do-you-still-need-framer-motion): The creator of the popular React animation library explains you might not need his library anymore thanks to 5 great new/upcoming CSS features.
* 📜 [Sneaky React Memory Leaks II: Closures Vs. React Query](https://schiener.io/2024-05-29/react-query-leaks): This follows up on last week's great article. This time it shows how React Query might be affected as well by memory leaks, and how to fix them. Using custom hooks looks like a good general solution to this problem.
* 📜 [An even faster Microsoft Edge](https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/2024/05/28/an-even-faster-microsoft-edge/): Microsoft was using React for some elements of the UI in its Edge browser and is now abandoning this approach. See the video linked below for more context.
* 📜 [Speeding up the JavaScript ecosystem - Server Side JSX](https://marvinh.dev/blog/speeding-up-javascript-ecosystem-part-9/): The JSX runtime of React can lead to many object allocations. Marvin (Preact/Deno) shows it's possible to precompile JSX to improve server rendering of JSX and reduce GC. Maybe React could use that as well?
* 📜 [Type-safe module mocking in Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/type-safe-module-mocking/): Very elegant way to leverage subpath imports for module mocking.
* 📜 [Multiple action handlers with Zod in Remix](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/zod-actions-remix): If you target one action endpoint from multiple components, this article shows you how to combine the different Zod schemas via discriminated union.
* 📜 [Embracing Slow Networks: Improving User Experience](https://www.epicweb.dev/embracing-slow-networks-improving-user-experience)
* 📜 [Cleaner components with useSuspenseQuery](https://swizec.com/blog/cleaner-components-with-use-suspense-query/) & [Why useSuspenseQuery works](https://swizec.com/blog/why-use-suspense-query-works/)
* 📜 [Explore new hooks coming up in React 19](https://blog.saeloun.com/2024/06/05/new-hooks-in-react-19/)
* 📦 [React 19.0.0-rc.0](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react/v/19.0.0-rc.0): Andrew Clark said "This is the exact build we'll release as 19.0, unless an issue is reported that requires a breaking change."
* 📦 [Docusaurus 3.4](https://docusaurus.io/blog/releases/3.4): A new way to centrally manage tags (great for consistency), an experimental hash router (great for offline browsing without a web server), and an option to use namespaces for local storage (useful if you’re deploying multiple instances of Docusaurus on the same domain).
* 🎙 [This Month in React, May 2024 - Updates from React Conf](https://www.reactiflux.com/transcripts/tmir-2024-05)
* 🎥 [Jack Herrington - Beware of "auto" Mode in the NextJS App Router](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bU3Px8bHjPA)
* 🎥 [Theo - Microsoft Regrets Using React (For Edge)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bm8Ga07BOnI)
* 🎥 [Stephanie Dietz - How to Use React's `useOptimistic` Hook](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ChF9-P4Bjs4)
* 🎥 [UI Engineering - Why 95% of Modals should be Local (in React)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iMoAviG_ZUE)
* 🎥 [Aaron Francis - Laravel vs React](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRtv-BVkwA4)
* 🎥 [Theo - How React Query Won](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xIflplz925Y)

segments.source_content: ## 💸 Sponsor {#sponsor2}

translations.ja: ## 💸 Sponsor {#sponsor2}

segments.source_content: [![WorkOS: enterprise-grade auth in minutes](/emails/issues/188/workOS.jpg)](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024)

translations.ja: [![WorkOS: エンタープライズ向け認証を数分で](/emails/issues/188/workOS.jpg)](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024)

segments.source_content: **[WorkOS: enterprise-grade auth in minutes](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024)**

translations.ja: **[WorkOS: エンタープライズ向け認証を数分で](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024)**

segments.source_content: 🔐 WorkOS supports a complete User Management solution along with **SSO, SCIM, RBAC, & FGA**.

translations.ja: 🔐 WorkOSは**SSO、SCIM、RBAC、FGA**を含む完全なユーザー管理ソリューションを提供します。

segments.source_content: 🗂️ Unlike other auth providers that rely on user-centric models, WorkOS is designed for B2B SaaS with an **org modeling approach**.

translations.ja: 🗂️ ユーザー中心モデルに依存する他の認証プロバイダーとは異なり、WorkOSは**組織モデリングアプローチ**でB2B SaaS向けに設計されています。

segments.source_content: 🏗️ The APIs are **flexible, easy-to-use, and modular**. Pick and choose what you need and integrate in minutes.

translations.ja: 🏗️ APIは**柔軟で使いやすく、モジュール式**です。必要な機能を選び、数分で統合できます。

segments.source_content: ✨ User Management is **free up to 1 million MAUs** and includes bot protection, impersonation, MFA, & more.

translations.ja: ✨ ユーザー管理は**100万MAUまで無料**で、ボット対策、なりすまし防止、MFAなどが含まれます。

segments.source_content: 🤝 WorkOS is trusted by hundreds of leading startups like **Perplexity**, **Vercel**, & **Webflow**.

translations.ja: 🤝 WorkOSは**Perplexity**、**Vercel**、**Webflow**など数百の主要スタートアップに信頼されています。

segments.source_content: Future-proof your auth stack with [WorkOS](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024) 🚀

translations.ja: [WorkOS](https://workos.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=q22024)で認証スタックを未来に備えましょう 🚀

segments.source_content: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

translations.ja: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

segments.source_content: ![Simon Grimm: Build React Native with Expo](/emails/issues/188/rn188.jpg)

translations.ja: ![Simon Grimm: ExpoでReact Nativeをビルド](/emails/issues/188/rn188.jpg)

segments.source_content: 🎥 **[Every Way to Build your React Native App with Expo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cs-zgHjt5RQ)**

translations.ja: 🎥 **[Expoを使ったReact Nativeアプリのあらゆるビルド方法](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cs-zgHjt5RQ)**

segments.source_content: Many roads lead to Rome, and it seems there are almost as many ways to build an Expo app. This gives us developers a lot of power and freedom, but can also sometimes lead to confusion - not just for beginners! Thankfully, Simon made a great video comparing the different approaches via Expo Go, Expo Prebuild, Xcode, Android Studio, and EAS. This is also a great opportunity to congratulate Expo on reaching [30k stars on GitHub!](https://x.com/expo/status/1796262781584654492)

translations.ja: 多くの道がローマに通じるように、Expoアプリをビルドする方法もほぼ同様に多岐にわたります。これは開発者に多くの力と自由を与えますが、初心者だけでなく混乱を招くこともあります！幸い、SimonはExpo Go、Expo Prebuild、Xcode、Android Studio、EASを使った異なるアプローチを比較する素晴らしい動画を作成しました。これはまた、Expoが[GitHubで30kスターを達成](https://x.com/expo/status/1796262781584654492)したことを祝福する良い機会でもあります。

segments.source_content:
* 💸 [React Native Mastery - The only course you need to Master React Native & Expo](https://notjust.dev/react-native-mastery?utm_source=twir\&utm_medium=email)
* 🐦 [The most powerful demo AI app, featuring RSC via Expo Router](https://x.com/Baconbrix/status/1795804445738963283): We’ve talked about Evan Bacon’s RSC demo before. This is a great thread on X summing up the promise and including a nice comparison video on how great mobile UI can get especially in the context of LLM chat apps.
* 📜 [React Native Security Guide](https://ospfranco.com/react-native-security-guide/): Oscar picks up a topic that doesn’t get talked about enough. This is a good intro, covering secrets (TLDR: Don’t store them on a device) and encryption of user data (including leveraging biometrics).
* 📜 [Seamless Transitions: From Native to React Native](https://commerce.nearform.com/blog/2024/seamless-transitions-from-native-to-react-native): Some impulses for brownfield development: Because RN creates truly native apps, introducing RN to an existing app or migrating to RN can be made seamless for the end users.
* 📦 [React Native 0.74.2](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.2): Patch release, bumping some dependencies (typescript-eslint, CLI) and fixing bugs.
* 📦 [React Native Reanimated 3.12.0](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/releases/tag/3.12.0): Introduces a new hook useComposedEventHandler which simplifies merging of multiple event handlers.
* 🎙️ [RNR 298 - Create Expo Stack, NativeWind Ul, & Plugin Pro with Dan Stepanov](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-298-create-expo-stack-nativewind-ul-plugin-pro-with-dan-stepanov)
* 🎥 [Rocket Ship 42 - React Native is alive! App.js Recap with Áron Berezkin](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GeUfrojkoo0)
* 🎥 [Expo - How to start your first Expo project in 2 minutes](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yOUAEfDuI44)

translations.ja:
* 💸 [React Native Mastery - React NativeとExpoをマスターする唯一のコース](https://notjust.dev/react-native-mastery?utm_source=twir\&utm_medium=email)
* 🐦 [最も強力なデモAIアプリ、Expo RouterによるRSCを特徴](https://x.com/Baconbrix/status/1795804445738963283): Evan BaconのRSCデモについて以前取り上げました。このXスレッドは、その可能性をまとめたもので、特にLLMチャットアプリにおけるモバイルUIの素晴らしさを比較動画で紹介しています。
* 📜 [React Nativeセキュリティガイド](https://ospfranco.com/react-native-security-guide/): Oscarが十分に議論されていないトピックを取り上げました。秘密情報（TLDR: デバイスに保存しない）やユーザーデータの暗号化（生体認証の活用を含む）をカバーした良い入門記事です。
* 📜 [シームレスな移行: ネイティブからReact Nativeへ](https://commerce.nearform.com/blog/2024/seamless-transitions-from-native-to-react-native): 既存アプリへのRN導入や移行をエンドユーザーにとってシームレスにするためのブラウンフィールド開発のヒント。
* 📦 [React Native 0.74.2](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.2): パッチリリース。typescript-eslintやCLIの依存関係更新とバグ修正。
* 📦 [React Native Reanimated 3.12.0](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/releases/tag/3.12.0): 複数イベントハンドラの統合を簡素化する新フックuseComposedEventHandlerを導入。
* 🎙️ [RNR 298 - Create Expo Stack、NativeWind UI、& Plugin Pro with Dan Stepanov](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-298-create-expo-stack-nativewind-ul-plugin-pro-with-dan-stepanov)
* 🎥 [Rocket Ship 42 - React Nativeは生きている！App.jsレポート with Áron Berezkin](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GeUfrojkoo0)
* 🎥 [Expo - 2分で始める最初のExpoプロジェクト](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yOUAEfDuI44)

segments.source_content: See ya! 👋

translations.ja: またね！ 👋
